description: Patterns for project management issues including schedule slippage, resource constraints, and scope creep

patterns.name: Schedule Slippage Detection
patterns.description: Detects project schedule delays, timeline issues, and deadline risks

hypotheses.statement: Inaccurate initial estimates may be causing schedule slippage for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Compare original estimates with actual time spent on completed tasks
Review estimation methodology and historical accuracy
Identify tasks with largest estimation variance
Analyze whether complexity was underestimated
Check if dependencies were properly accounted for in estimates
expectedFindings: Consistent underestimation of task complexity (>30% variance)
Lack of historical data used in estimation
Technical unknowns not factored into estimates

hypotheses.statement: Blocked dependencies or external bottlenecks may be causing delays in {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Map critical path and identify blocking dependencies
Review external team or vendor delivery timelines
Analyze wait times between dependent tasks
Check for circular dependencies or deadlocks
Identify single points of failure in the dependency chain
expectedFindings: Tasks blocked waiting for external deliverables
Critical path items delayed by dependencies
Vendor or third-party delays impacting timeline

hypotheses.statement: Resource availability issues may be contributing to schedule delays for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Review team capacity and allocation across projects
Check for key personnel absences or turnover
Analyze context switching overhead from multiple projects
Identify skill gaps causing work to queue
Review meeting load and interruption patterns
expectedFindings: Team members allocated to multiple competing projects
Skill bottlenecks causing work to queue

hypotheses.statement: Unplanned scope changes may be causing schedule slippage for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Track scope changes since project inception
Quantify effort added by scope changes
Review change request approval process
Analyze impact of scope changes on timeline
Check if schedule was adjusted for scope changes
expectedFindings: Significant scope additions without timeline adjustment
Informal scope changes bypassing change control

recommendations.action: Conduct detailed schedule analysis to identify root causes of slippage for {{primarySubject}}
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Clear understanding of delay causes and impacted milestones

recommendations.action: Review and improve estimation practices using historical data
recommendations.expectedOutcome: More accurate estimates with appropriate buffers

recommendations.action: Create comprehensive dependency map and identify critical path
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Visibility into blocking dependencies and optimization opportunities

recommendations.action: Develop schedule recovery plan with options for getting back on track
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Actionable plan to recover schedule with trade-off analysis

recommendations.action: Implement buffer management and early warning indicators
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Early detection of schedule risks before they become critical

recommendations.action: Establish transparent communication with stakeholders about schedule status
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Aligned expectations and collaborative problem-solving

patterns.name: Resource Constraint Detection
patterns.description: Detects project resource constraints including staffing issues, budget limitations, and capacity problems

hypotheses.statement: Insufficient staffing levels may be constraining project progress for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Compare current team size with project requirements
Analyze workload distribution across team members
Review hiring pipeline and time-to-fill metrics
Identify roles with highest demand vs availability gap
Check contractor or outsourcing options
expectedFindings: Open positions unfilled for extended periods
Critical roles with single point of failure

hypotheses.statement: Skill gaps or mismatches may be creating resource constraints for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Map required skills against team capabilities
Identify tasks queued due to skill unavailability
Review training and upskilling opportunities
Analyze knowledge transfer effectiveness
Check for over-reliance on specific individuals
expectedFindings: Specific skills in short supply relative to demand
Work queued waiting for specialized resources

hypotheses.statement: Inefficient resource allocation may be creating artificial constraints for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Review resource allocation across projects
Analyze context switching and multitasking overhead
Check for resources allocated but underutilized
Identify priority conflicts between projects
Review resource request and approval process
expectedFindings: Resources split across too many projects
Misalignment between allocation and actual needs

hypotheses.statement: Budget constraints may be limiting ability to acquire necessary resources for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Review project budget vs actual spending
Identify unfunded resource requirements
Analyze cost of delay vs cost of additional resources
Check for budget reallocation opportunities
Review vendor and contractor options
expectedFindings: Cost constraints preventing tool or training investment
ROI case for additional investment not made

recommendations.action: Conduct comprehensive capacity analysis to quantify resource gaps for {{primarySubject}}
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Clear picture of resource supply vs demand with quantified gaps

recommendations.action: Perform skill gap assessment and create capability matrix
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Identified skill gaps with prioritized development plan

recommendations.action: Optimize resource allocation to maximize effective capacity
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Improved resource utilization and reduced context switching

recommendations.action: Accelerate hiring process for critical roles
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Faster time-to-fill for critical positions

recommendations.action: Engage contractors or consultants to address immediate capacity gaps
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Rapid capacity increase for critical needs

recommendations.action: Invest in training and upskilling to address skill gaps
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Expanded team capabilities and reduced skill bottlenecks

recommendations.action: Prioritize scope to match available resources
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Aligned scope with realistic resource capacity

patterns.name: Scope Creep Detection
patterns.description: Detects uncontrolled scope expansion, requirements volatility, and change management issues

hypotheses.statement: Weak or absent change control process may be allowing uncontrolled scope expansion for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Review change request process and approval workflow
Analyze how scope changes are currently being introduced
Check for informal scope additions bypassing process
Review stakeholder access to add requirements
Assess impact assessment practices for changes
expectedFindings: No formal change control process in place
Stakeholders adding scope directly to backlog
No baseline to measure scope changes against

hypotheses.statement: Unclear or incomplete initial requirements may be driving scope changes for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Review original requirements documentation quality
Analyze scope changes for patterns (clarifications vs additions)
Check stakeholder alignment on requirements
Review requirements gathering process
Assess requirements sign-off and validation

hypotheses.statement: Stakeholder pressure or poor expectation management may be driving scope additions for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Review stakeholder requests and their approval path
Analyze relationship between stakeholder seniority and scope changes
Check for competing stakeholder priorities
Review communication of scope constraints
Assess stakeholder understanding of trade-offs
expectedFindings: Senior stakeholders adding scope without process
Difficulty saying no to stakeholder requests

hypotheses.statement: Team gold-plating or over-engineering may be expanding scope beyond requirements for {{primarySubject}}
investigationSteps: Review delivered features vs original requirements
Check for unrequested enhancements or features
Analyze time spent on polish vs core functionality
Review technical decisions for over-engineering
Assess team understanding of MVP and priorities
expectedFindings: Features delivered beyond what was requested
Technical solutions more complex than needed

recommendations.action: Conduct scope audit to quantify scope changes since baseline for {{primarySubject}}
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Clear picture of scope growth with categorized changes

recommendations.action: Implement or strengthen formal change control process
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Controlled scope changes with proper impact assessment

recommendations.action: Establish clear requirements baseline with stakeholder sign-off
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Agreed baseline to measure scope changes against

recommendations.action: Require impact assessment for all scope changes before approval
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Informed decisions on scope changes with understood trade-offs

recommendations.action: Educate stakeholders on scope management and trade-offs
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Stakeholders understand impact of scope changes

recommendations.action: Negotiate scope reduction to bring project back to sustainable level
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Right-sized scope aligned with constraints

recommendations.action: Refocus team on MVP delivery and defer non-essential features
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Clear focus on essential deliverables
